Articles.Content: I decided to try something--I had a load of tourists along, a couple of which wished to land.  I was originally planning to take them back on a lander but I had enough dV so I saved and pointed Mechjeb at a reasonably flat part of Minmus.  I have a big, ungainly rocket (10 kerbels on board, I'm still carrying the booster that I lit to finish orbital insertion above Kerbin and which took me into Mun orbit as well) and SAS + RCS wasn't enough to hold it perfectly stable by any means.  It didn't matter, though--even though I touched down while leaning 30 degrees and instantly lit the booster again my Kerbals were happy with having landed.

If flying through space and touching a minty green space rock is easy, then yes, they are easy to impress.

Personally I'd be horrified, but I'm a little more attached to my existence then Kerbals seem to be.

Edit: Wait until you get one asking for suborbital flight on the Sun.

Edited March 16, 2016 by Randazzo
Yeah, those ones i leave for another space agency.... or jeb on his days off.
Every station I make the kerbals are fine until I dock, then the world is ending. I imagine heavy metal playing in their heads every docking.
